clinical_study.brief_title: Procedures and Follow-up of Percutaneous Tracheostomy in Intensive Care Unit
clinical_study.official_title: Procedures, Complications and Follow-up of Percutaneous Tracheostomies in Intensive Care Unit

brief_summary.textblock: Tracheostomy is worldwide performed in Intensive Care Unit (ICU). According to the current literature, indication for percutaneous tracheostomy (PDT) in ICU are: difficult prolonged weaning, prolonged mechanical ventilation, loss of airway reflex, copious secretions, upper airway obstruction. Many studies have focused on the comparison between different PDT techniques and complication. The aim of our study is to evaluate the procedural features, complications, ICU mortality, quality of life, post-discharge mortality of patients undergoing different PDT techniques performed in ICU.

clinical_study.study_design: Observational Model: Case-Only, Time Perspective: Prospective

primary_outcome.time_frame: at the beginning and at the end of the procedure

secondary_outcome.time_frame: in the first 24 hours from the end of the procedure
secondary_outcome.description: Early complications are:multiple intubation attempts (more than 1), accidental extubation, paratracheal insertion, injuries to blood vessels in the neck, oesophageal injury, accidental decannulation, malposition of the tracheostomy tube, tracheal cuff puncture, multiple punctures (more than 1), surgical conversion and percutaneous tracheostomy failure, minor bleeding (compressible), major bleeding (incompressible), pneumothorax

secondary_outcome.time_frame: from the 2nd day ofter the procedure until the ICU discharge (expected average of 2 weeks)
secondary_outcome.description: Late complications are: minor bleeding (compressible), major bleeding (incompressible) tracheostomy puncture site infection, subglottic stenosis, fracture of a tracheal cartilage, granuloma.
The investigator will use the EURO-QOL
The investigator will perform a flexible fiberoptic laryngoscopy.
the investigator will use a KAY elemetrics analyzer.

arm_group.description: The investigator will enroll all the critical ill patients undergoing percutaneous tracheostomy performed in ICU

intervention.description: Percutaneous tracheostomies will be performed with the kit commercially available in the current clinical practice.
